# documentRect

**Instance Property**

The rectangle defining the document view’s frame, adjusted to the size of the clip view if the document view is smaller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var documentRect: NSRect { get }
```

## Discussion

The document rectangle is used in conjunction with an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] object’s bounds rectangle to determine values for the indicators of relative position and size between the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView] and its document view. For example, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView] uses these rectangles to set the size and position of the knobs in its scrollers. When the document view is much larger than the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSClipView], the knob is small; when the document view is near the same size, the knob is large; and when the document view is the same size or smaller, there is no knob.

## Related Documentation

## Accessing the Visible Portion

- **documentVisibleRect**: The exposed rectangle of the clip view’s document view, in the document view’s own coordinate system.
